Everyone is better than me at this game. Noed sucks. Facing SWF is awful and warrants me wanting to die. Keys are terrible. I have like 50-60 hours and face legacy players with 6k + hours as Killer, and get tunneled and camped as survivor.

overall fun when it isn't :)

Game is super addicting. Really repetitive and wish it had more objectives than fixing generators but overall it's fun running around and looping killers if you know your way around. Leans a bit on pay to win but at least it has a random weekly set of perks to purchase using in game currency... lul

Great game, but horrible matchmaking. The matchmaking discourages new killers since they always end up facing survivors 10x better than them. For the past 5 killer games, I've gotten at least one red rank and one purple rank. I really hope that the developers fix this huge issue!
phenomenal performance by the devs telling the killer where i am 24/7

Was mich in letzter Zeit wahnsinnig nervt, sind die Killer die meinen mÃ¼ssen zu campen. Die bleiben dann manchmal so lange bei dir, bis man tot ist. Sie lassen einem nicht mal die MÃ¶glichkeit, den Ãœberlebenden abzuhÃ¤ngen.
Es wÃ¤re echt cool wenn man daran was Ã¤ndern kÃ¶nnte oder so.

I regret many things I've done and haven't done in my life, but the biggest regret of them all is that I still keep coming back to this game time after time.

And now after a year and 338 more hours flushed down the drain I'm back here to warn those fortunate people who haven't sunk 1000+ hours on this dumpster-fire of a game. Don't waste your money and time for this. It's not worth it. You might have fun at first, and get addicted to this, but after the little fun from the one-dimensional gameplay wears off and you get tired of called by various names both in illiterate English and Russian you are left with bitterness and sadness, and you even might end up venting these feelings in a Steam-review like I am doing right now. You don't want to end up like this loser weeaboo with 1000+ hours on Dead by Daylight right? Didn't think so either.

To convince some of you even more here are a selection of things I personally dislike about the game and things behind it:

Every update is a freaking joke. Most of the time they break more things than they fix, and sometimes they don't even fix the things they claim to say they fix.

Every DLC launch without exception either gives birth to a fuck-ton of bugs, breaks already existing maps for some reason or it's launched in a state where the map included in it can't even be played for the first month or so (Resident Evil DLC, though I guess Raccoon City being disabled was a blessing in disguise in retrospect). 

Game has severe balance issues (or more like always has been), and after every attempt to fix these the new perks, nerfs/buffs and the likes just widens the gap most of the time. Community has had some pretty great suggestions to fix, or at least make things more fair for both sides, but this leads to another problem I personally have with this game.

Community doesn't really get their voices out, or if they do the BHVR doesn't really show any signs that they'd listen to it. Outside of some tweaks community, who's clearly loving this game gives a lot of good pointers and suggestions to make overall game more enjoyable, but sadly they seem to be talking to deaf ears at this point.

BHVR also did NFTs related to the Hellraiser DLC, when I thought my opinion of this game couldn't go any lower they magically found a way to make that happen!

Toxic community is something you can expect from every multiplayer PvP-game, and DbD is not exception, however the amount of toxicity in this game rivals to such salt-filled classics like CS:GO and LoL

Unfair gameplay-tactics such as tunneling and camping are approved as valid tactics by the BHVR themselves. I know that preventing this isn't easy, but to the people behind the game give this a thumbs up is pretty weird.

Gameplay gets tedious on the survivor side after a while, and there probably won't be any major additions to it. You can try to make some different perk builds I guess, but that also has it's limits, especially when a good amount of the perks are basically useless, or work in really specific situations or builds.

I actually want to like this game, but at it's current state I just can't. Slowly but surely I've gladly started to drift in the direction of other multiplayer-games and I believe that within the next year I will finally be freed from the shackles of this horrifying game, or that's at least what I hope.
Toma cuidado com o moÃ§o la

[h1]Not Recommended.[/h1]
[b]Note: I've originally played this game on Xbox One before I hesitantly got it for PC on sale[/b]

[b]In Short:[/b] [i]Lack of competent development is killing the game as well as promoting a toxic community and environment.[/i]

The review is organized by categories with additional notes if I have something to add.

[b]Game's Visuals (Graphics)[/b]
[ ] Beautiful
[x] Good
[ ] Decent
[ ] Bad
[ ] Poor

Personal Note: The game fairly recently received a visual update in a form of a downloadable update. To the original product, I'd say the graphics used to be decent.

[b]Game's Sound Design[/b]
[ ] Beautiful
[ ] Good
[x] Decent
[ ] Bad
[ ] Poor

Personal Note: This game doesn't have much in terms of sound design or voice acting. However, this game heavily relies on good sound design as a core mechanic. You need to hear the Killer's approaching heartbeat, the survivor's breathing, the sound of the crows being disturbed. Although I personally don't encounter it as much, I do have to mention many players complained about those core mechanics not working. From personal experience, I say it's decent, but it has to be at least good.

[b]Gameplay Mechanics[/b]
[ ] Beautiful
[ ] Good
[ ] Decent
[ ] Bad
[x] Poor

Personal Note: This game has unique gameplay, which makes it very appealing in an industry filled mostly with FPS genres. However, it's always broken. Whether it was due to poor latency, exploit/bugs, or lack of a balance, I always encountered an unfair situation. There was not a single moment in this game's history where I can say "Yup, I lost fair and square" consistently. Perhaps I could have some bias, but I know how to accept defeat in a virtual computer game. I have no complaints like that in other video games, such as CS:GO, Overwatch, Team Fortress 2, or literally anything else I play. If I lose, I want to know that the chances were fair and I simply lacked the teamwork or personal skill. In this game, you will not get that chance.

[b]Story/Narrative[/b]
[ ] Beautiful
[ ] Good
[x] Decent
[ ] Bad
[ ] Poor

Personal Note: It has lore now... that's about it. The premise of the game is intriguing, but nothing crazy to pull me in and make me hungry for more information.

[b]Replayability[/b]
[x]Yes
[ ] Kinda
[ ] None

Personal Note: Definitely. It's a multiplayer/co-op game with the same objective every single time. The only factor that will vary from match to match is the people and characters they play. Although, there is a certain META you will encounter more often than not. Certain perks, abilities, or even characters.

[b]Final Note:[/b]
Overall, I have more negative experience than positive memories. This is absolutely the development team's fault, and Mathieu Cote represents its face. Their actions, words and choices speak for themselves. 

At this point, they care more about your wallet than your experience. When this game desperately needs critical fixes and development support, they release expensive cosmetics and skins. You may literally look up many videos on the internet with Mathieu where the Dead by Daylight community meme's on him. I don't have anything against him as a person, [i]so far[/i]. But, as a developer, I do not respect him. He is killing this game. Lack of balance, especially for Killer Mains on this game, is suffocating the community and forces the casual players to leave. Survivors are not only given tools to bully and harass human beings that choose to play a Killer, but the developers promote such behavior through silly updates and in-game challenges. Of course, Killers may also bully survivors, but not as often as survivors bully Killers. There's only so much you can do against an organized team. This game attracted a very toxic community, and you may literally experience cyber-bullying on regular basis. Don't expect a good report system either, since the developers didn't care to implement a convenient report system to regulate toxic behavior or gameplay exploitation (Hackers also happen fairly often).

I could write a whole essay on fundamental issues with this game. However, there's plenty of well-organized videos and articles that will present that information better than I can in a Steam Review. Every single corner and aspect of this game has a problem with it. [i]Gameplay, mechanics, development, support, sound, graphics, community, and so on.[/i] Every category has or at some point had an issue with it. For every fix, two new problems are introduced. Instead of prioritizing development, they monetize a broken game. I am surprised they didn't label this game as an "Early Alpha," cause it certainly feels like one. [b]Save your nerves, find something better to do or play.[/b]

"[i]Maybe try survivor a little bit, maybe you're just tired. Change it up every now and then, or take a break. Play something else for like a week. We are working on balance all the time. Some of it can come from our ranking and that needs fixing.[/i]"
- Mathieu Cote, Producer of Dead by Daylight according to IMBd.

Did not find the game fun at all.

I burnt myself out from playing this game, but I still find it fun from time to time and I actually enjoy the controls. to some people they are bad but I like the clunky+arcade feeling to it when playing survivor. 

One of the only downsides is the optimization of this game as well as it not having a whole lot of updates. good enough though, recommend it when its on sale.

This game has a lot of issues. EXTREME lack of player moderation, developers rarely ever listen to consumers unless it's in their immediate financial interest. The game has tons of bugs, with one of the most toxic communities, and I've played both WoW and League of Legends. The matchmaking is horrendous, with people in top tier ranks being matched with new or low-ranked people. It's frustrating, and the developers just slap some tape on it and say "pretty good job so far." I've dumped money and hours into this game because I always come back to see a new killer and such, but nothing really ever changes. The devs really disappointed me.
One of my favorite games, even moved to pc from almost 3 years of xbox
A very good game to play with or without friends. Matchmaking as a survivor can take a little bit but is 100 % worth it.

el juego llevo pocas horas jugandolo y les doy mi sincera opinion, el juego es increible es como un simulador de un asesino y o una persona intentando escapar de un psicopata, cuando juego como survivor me da mas tension ya que cuando veo la luz roja o los latidos del sobreviviente o tambien escuchar la cancion de persecucion me pone nervioso, juego mas como killer para desarrollar mas mi habilidad con los killers que solo me faltan 3 the twins the plague y the witch, la verdad es que si lo recomiendo muco si eres fan de este tipo de juegos, muy bien hecho
Good game overall just need to fix some bugs and matchmaking queues and its good to go! :)

Heyja this game is one of a kind. If u like to chase down some survivors, and murder them in a cruel way over and over while expanding your skills doeing so, this is the game for you! You can smash them crush them and even take selfies while you squeeze out the little that is left in them. But dont be fooled by them. You will also encounter extremly good players on the survivor team! They will make you lose your insanity forcing you to chase them in a marygoround over and over again untill you find a way to out play them :> 
For the survivor side your main objective is to repairing generators while keeping the killer busy in one way or another, until your team finishes the objective and opens the escape gates, for you and your team to get out of there. This is highly based on teamplay to succed. You need to balance: Repairing generators, helping other survivors, and much more other stuff to be escaping winning in the end. GLHF
Cara, jogo divertido de mais para jogar sozinho

I really love the game and have spent a lot of time playing it by myself and with friends as both killer and survivor. I would recommend this game though there does need to be some balancing and bug fixes such as a nerf to survivors because they still finish gens too quickly leading to a game to be finished to fast or not a lot of the currency earned because I either can't work on gens fast enough as survivor or thee survivors finish gens so fast that I can do nothing but accept defeat. But other than that, I feel this is a really fun game to play by yourself and with friends.

Only played one game so this review is very unfair and may very well change. First I did not like how limited I was in picking survivors and their outfits. A lot of the outfits I seen were brightly colored, nice way to stay camouflaged. I really did not like that I could not customize my player name. It was taking so long to join a game I considered firing up Youtube while I waited but whenever I do that in a game I have a bad habit of forgetting about the game losing interest. The graphics were plenty good enough for me. I didn't pay much attention to the sound or have my stereo on but so far no complaints. Right away in the game a killer was on my tail. I tried running and failed. They put me on a hook and I failed to escape. The kill scene was kinda cool. It seemed all too fast for me to get any enjoyment. I went to play another game but it was taking way too long so I just quit and decided to write a 'first impressions' review instead.

best horror game, especially with friends. Well made not many bugs, always goes on sale for around $7.99 I'd wait for that. They have updated the graphics so it looks and runs better. They are always adding new killers and survivors.
